intro: Erepsia steytlerae, commonly known as the Steytlerville ericoid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact shrub form and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Erepsia steytlerae is well adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often growing in coastal or mountainous regions.
